title: Koh Chang
description: Koh Chang (elephant Island) is Thailand’s second-largest island and the primary Destination for those visiting Koh Chang Marine national park, which includes dozens of unspoiled islands.
departure: Thursday 12 September in the evening, by Rental Car. Sleep at the pier. Ferry in the morning.
leaving: Sunday 15 September in the morning by Bus or Taxi, for Yuki/Lois
Monday 16 September at noon by Rental car,  for the rest

title: Koh Mak
description: Koh Mak is a quiet location for people who are looking for a relaxing holiday.  If you are looking for long deserted beaches then you’ll find them on Koh Mak.  There aren’t any jetskis or beer bars.  So it isn’t for someone looking for an alternative to Phuket or Pattaya.
departure: Thursday 12 September in the evening, by Rental Car. Sleep at the pier. Ferry in the morning.
leaving: Sunday 15 September in the morning by Bus or Taxi, for Yuki/Lois
Monday 16 September at noon by Rental car, for the rest

title: Koh Samet
description: Koh Samet is a popular weekend getaway for Thais and foreigners living in Bangkok, so there are dozens of Beach resorts, bars, and restaurants on nearly every beach, although visitors are allowed to camp if they wish to do so.
departure: Friday 13 September by Bus or Van.
leaving: Sunday 15 September in the afternoon by Bus or Taxi, for Yuki/Lois
Monday 16 September in the afternoon by Bus or Taxi, for the rest

title: Chumphon Prachuap
description: The provincial capital of Prachuap Khiri Khan is a Fishing port with a superb location beside beautiful curving bays and amongst steep mountain outcrops. Chumphon is a southern province (changwat) of Thailand on the Gulf of Thailand. Neighbouring provinces are Prachuap Khiri Khan, Surat Thani, and Ranong.
location: Chumphon Province, Prachuap Khiri Khan Province
departure: Thursday 12 September evening, by Rental Car.
Friday 13 September in the morning by Bus, Taxi or Train
leaving: Sunday 15 September at noon by Train or in the afternoon by Bus, Taxi, for Yuki/Lois
Monday 16 September in the afternoon if Rental Car or, at noon by Train, or in the afternoon by Bus or Taxi for the rest

title: Sai Yok
description: A popular national park for local and foreign tourists, known for its waterfalls, caves, historical sites and raft houses along its main river Khwae Noi. The park covers 958 km² in Sai Yok District of Kanchanaburi Province, the entrance is about 100 km northwest of Kanchanaburi City.
departure: Thursday 12 September in the evening, by Rental Car, Bus, Train or Van.
leaving: Sunday 15 September in the afternoon by Bus, Taxi or Train, for Yuki/Lois
Monday 16 September in the afternoon by Bus, Taxi or Train, for the rest

title: Koh Tao
description: The tiny Island of Koh Tao ('Turtle Island'), 45 km north of Koh Phangan, is one of the top scuba diving destinations in Thailand.
departure: Thursday 12 September 9pm by NightBus, arriving 13/09 9am morning.
leaving: Sunday 15 September 10am or 2pm by Bus, for Yuki/Lois
Monday 16 September 10am or 2pm arriving 9pm or 1am by bus, for the rest.

title: Krabi
description: Krabi is famous for its scenic view and breathtaking Beaches and Islands. Its coral reef vistas are also one of the world’s most beautiful, which makes the City a great spot for coral diving.
departure: Friday 13 September in the morning by Flight
leaving: Sunday 15 September at 5pm by Nightbus for Yuki/Lois
Monday 16 September at 5pm by Nightbus or by Flight for the rest.
cons: Lois might stab me for taking a plane
